intro: Ischnea spathulata f. spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf ischnea, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive broad, spatulate leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its leaves are usually smooth and have a mild, slightly peppery scent when crushed. The flowering stems bear small, clustered white flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
